28 #include "../../include/geometry/CPhysicalGeometry.hpp"

31 #include "../../include/toolboxes/CLinearPartitioner.hpp"
32 #include "../../include/toolboxes/C1DInterpolation.hpp"
33 #include "../../include/toolboxes/geometry_toolbox.hpp"
34 #include "../../include/geometry/meshreader/CSU2ASCIIMeshReaderFVM.hpp"
35 #include "../../include/geometry/meshreader/CCGNSMeshReaderFVM.hpp"
36 #include "../../include/geometry/meshreader/CRectangularMeshReaderFVM.hpp"
37 #include "../../include/geometry/meshreader/CBoxMeshReaderFVM.hpp"

40 #include "../../include/geometry/primal_grid/CLine.hpp"
41 #include "../../include/geometry/primal_grid/CTriangle.hpp"

47 #include "../../include/geometry/primal_grid/CVertexMPI.hpp"

58 
59 CPhysicalGeometry::CPhysicalGeometry() : CGeometry() { }
60 
61 CPhysicalGeometry::CPhysicalGeometry(CConfig *config, unsigned short val_iZone, unsigned short val_nZone) : CGeometry() {
62 
63  edgeColorGroupSize = config->GetEdgeColoringGroupSize();
64 
65  string text_line, Marker_Tag;
66  ifstream mesh_file;
67  unsigned short iDim, iMarker, iNodes;
68  unsigned long iPoint, iElem_Bound;
69  nZone = val_nZone;
70  ofstream boundary_file;
71  string Grid_Marker;
72 
73  string val_mesh_filename = config->GetMesh_FileName();
74  unsigned short val_format = config->GetMesh_FileFormat();
75 
76  /*--- Determine whether or not a FEM discretization is used ---*/
77 
78  const bool fem_solver = config->GetFEMSolver();
79 
80  /*--- Initialize counters for local/global points & elements ---*/
81 
82  if( fem_solver ) {
83  switch (val_format) {
84  case SU2:
85  Read_SU2_Format_Parallel_FEM(config, val_mesh_filename, val_iZone, val_nZone);
86  break;
87 
88  case CGNS_GRID:
89  Read_CGNS_Format_Parallel_FEM(config, val_mesh_filename, val_iZone, val_nZone);
90  break;
91 
92  default:
93  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized mesh format specified for the FEM solver!", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
94  break;
95  }
96  }
97  else {
98 
99  switch (val_format) {
100  case SU2: case CGNS_GRID: case RECTANGLE: case BOX:
101  Read_Mesh_FVM(config, val_mesh_filename, val_iZone, val_nZone);
102  break;
103  default:
104  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized mesh format specified!", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
105  break;
106  }
107  }
108 
109  /*--- After reading the mesh, assert that the dimension is equal to 2 or 3. ---*/
110 
111  assert(((nDim == 2) || (nDim == 3)) && "There shall be bugs.");
112 
113  /*--- Loop over the points element to re-scale the mesh, and plot it (only SU2_CFD) ---*/
114 
115  if (config->GetKind_SU2() == SU2_COMPONENT::SU2_CFD) {
116 
117  /*--- The US system uses feet, but SU2 assumes that the grid is in inches ---*/
118 
119  if (config->GetSystemMeasurements() == US) {
120  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPoint; iPoint++) {
121  for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) {
122  nodes->SetCoord(iPoint, iDim, nodes->GetCoord(iPoint, iDim)/12.0);
123  }
124  }
125  }
126 
127  }
128 
129  /*--- If SU2_DEF then write a file with the boundary information ---*/
130 
131  if ((config->GetKind_SU2() == SU2_COMPONENT::SU2_DEF) && (rank == MASTER_NODE)) {
132 
133  string str = "boundary.dat";
134 
135  str = config->GetMultizone_FileName(str, val_iZone, ".dat");
136 
137  /*--- Open .su2 grid file ---*/
138 
139  boundary_file.open(str.c_str(), ios::out);
140 
141  /*--- Loop through and write the boundary info ---*/
142 
143  boundary_file << "NMARK= " << nMarker << endl;
144 
145  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
146 
147  Grid_Marker = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
148  boundary_file << "MARKER_TAG= " << Grid_Marker << endl;
149  boundary_file << "MARKER_ELEMS= " << nElem_Bound[iMarker]<< endl;
150  boundary_file << "SEND_TO= " << config->GetMarker_All_SendRecv(iMarker) << endl;
151  if (nDim == 2) {
152  for (iElem_Bound = 0; iElem_Bound < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; iElem_Bound++) {
153  boundary_file << bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetVTK_Type() << "\t" ;
154  for (iNodes = 0; iNodes < bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetnNodes(); iNodes++)
155  boundary_file << bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetNode(iNodes) << "\t" ;
156 
157  if (bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetVTK_Type() == VERTEX) {
158  boundary_file << bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetRotation_Type() << "\t";
159  }
160  boundary_file << iElem_Bound << endl;
161  }
162  }
163 
164  if (nDim == 3) {
165  for (iElem_Bound = 0; iElem_Bound < nElem_Bound[iMarker]; iElem_Bound++) {
166  boundary_file << bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetVTK_Type() << "\t" ;
167  for (iNodes = 0; iNodes < bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetnNodes(); iNodes++)
168  boundary_file << bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetNode(iNodes) << "\t" ;
169 
170  if (bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetVTK_Type() == VERTEX) {
171  boundary_file << bound[iMarker][iElem_Bound]->GetRotation_Type() << "\t";
172  }
173  boundary_file << iElem_Bound << endl;
174  }
175  }
176 
177  }
178 
179  boundary_file.close();
180 
181  }
182 
183  /*--- If the gradient smoothing solver is active, allocate space for the sensitivity and initialize. ---*/
184  if (config->GetSmoothGradient()) {
185  Sensitivity.resize(nPoint,nDim) = su2double(0.0);
186  }
187 
188 }
189 
190 CPhysicalGeometry::CPhysicalGeometry(CGeometry *geometry,
191  CConfig *config) : CGeometry() {
192 
193  edgeColorGroupSize = config->GetEdgeColoringGroupSize();
194 
195  /*--- The new geometry class has the same problem dimension/zone. ---*/
196 
197  nDim = geometry->GetnDim();
198  nZone = geometry->GetnZone();
199 
200  /*--- Recompute the linear partitioning offsets. ---*/
201 
202  PrepareOffsets(geometry->GetGlobal_nPoint());
203 
204  /*--- Communicate the coloring data so that each rank has a complete set
205  of colors for all points that reside on it, including repeats. ---*/
206 
207  if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (size != SINGLE_NODE))
208  cout <<"Distributing ParMETIS coloring." << endl;
209 
210  DistributeColoring(config, geometry);
211 
212  /*--- Redistribute the points to all ranks based on the coloring. ---*/
213 
214  if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (size != SINGLE_NODE))
215  cout <<"Rebalancing vertices." << endl;
216 
217  DistributePoints(config, geometry);
218 
219  /*--- Distribute the element information to all ranks based on coloring. ---*/
220 
221  if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (size != SINGLE_NODE))
222  cout <<"Rebalancing volume element connectivity." << endl;
223 
224  DistributeVolumeConnectivity(config, geometry, TRIANGLE );
225  DistributeVolumeConnectivity(config, geometry, QUADRILATERAL);
226  DistributeVolumeConnectivity(config, geometry, TETRAHEDRON );
227  DistributeVolumeConnectivity(config, geometry, HEXAHEDRON );
228  DistributeVolumeConnectivity(config, geometry, PRISM );
229  DistributeVolumeConnectivity(config, geometry, PYRAMID );
230 
231  /*--- Distribute the marker information to all ranks based on coloring. ---*/
232 
233  if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (size != SINGLE_NODE))
234  cout <<"Rebalancing markers and surface elements." << endl;
235 
236  /*--- First, perform a linear partitioning of the marker information, as
237  the grid readers currently store all boundary information on the master
238  rank. In the future, this process can be moved directly into the grid
239  reader to avoid reading the markers to the master rank alone at first. ---*/
240 
241  DistributeMarkerTags(config, geometry);
242  PartitionSurfaceConnectivity(config, geometry, LINE );
243  PartitionSurfaceConnectivity(config, geometry, TRIANGLE );
244  PartitionSurfaceConnectivity(config, geometry, QUADRILATERAL);
245 
246  /*--- Once the markers are distributed according to the linear partitioning
247  of the grid points, we can use similar techniques as above for distributing
248  the surface element connectivity. ---*/
249 
250  DistributeSurfaceConnectivity(config, geometry, LINE );
251  DistributeSurfaceConnectivity(config, geometry, TRIANGLE );
252  DistributeSurfaceConnectivity(config, geometry, QUADRILATERAL);
253 
254  /*--- Reduce the total number of elements that we have on each rank. ---*/
255 
256  nLocal_Elem = (nLocal_Tria +
257  nLocal_Quad +
258  nLocal_Tetr +
259  nLocal_Hexa +
260  nLocal_Pris +
261  nLocal_Pyra);
262  nLocal_Bound_Elem = nLocal_Line + nLocal_BoundTria + nLocal_BoundQuad;
263 
264  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&nLocal_Elem, &nGlobal_Elem, 1,
265  MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
266  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&nLocal_Bound_Elem, &nGlobal_Bound_Elem, 1,
267  MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
268 
269  /*--- With the distribution of all points, elements, and markers based
270  on the ParMETIS coloring complete, as a final step, load this data into
271  our geometry class data structures. ---*/
272 
273  LoadPoints(config, geometry);
274  LoadVolumeElements(config, geometry);
275  LoadSurfaceElements(config, geometry);
276 
277  /*--- If the gradient smoothing solver is active, allocate space for the sensitivity and initialize. ---*/
278  if (config->GetSmoothGradient()) {
279  Sensitivity.resize(nPoint,nDim) = su2double(0.0);
280  }
281 
282  /*--- Free memory associated with the partitioning of points and elems. ---*/
283 
284  decltype(Neighbors)().swap(Neighbors);
285  decltype(Color_List)().swap(Color_List);
286 
287  delete [] Local_Points;
288  delete [] Local_Colors;
289  delete [] Local_Coords;
290 
291  delete [] Conn_Line_Linear;
292  delete [] Conn_BoundTria_Linear;
293  delete [] Conn_BoundQuad_Linear;
294 
295  delete [] Conn_Line;
296  delete [] Conn_BoundTria;
297  delete [] Conn_BoundQuad;
298  delete [] Conn_Tria;
299  delete [] Conn_Quad;
300  delete [] Conn_Tetr;
301  delete [] Conn_Hexa;
302  delete [] Conn_Pris;
303  delete [] Conn_Pyra;
304 
305  delete [] ID_Line;
306  delete [] ID_BoundTria;
307  delete [] ID_BoundQuad;
308  delete [] ID_Line_Linear;
309  delete [] ID_BoundTria_Linear;
310  delete [] ID_BoundQuad_Linear;
311 
312  delete [] ID_Tria;
313  delete [] ID_Quad;
314  delete [] ID_Tetr;
315  delete [] ID_Hexa;
316  delete [] ID_Pris;
317  delete [] ID_Pyra;
318 
319  delete [] Elem_ID_Line;
320  delete [] Elem_ID_BoundTria;
321  delete [] Elem_ID_BoundQuad;
322  delete [] Elem_ID_Line_Linear;
323  delete [] Elem_ID_BoundTria_Linear;
324  delete [] Elem_ID_BoundQuad_Linear;
325 
326 }
327 
328 CPhysicalGeometry::~CPhysicalGeometry(void) {
329 
330  delete [] Local_to_Global_Point;
331 
332  /*--- Free up memory from turbomachinery performance computation ---*/
333 
334  unsigned short iMarker;
335  if (TangGridVelIn != nullptr) {
336  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nTurboPerf; iMarker++)
337  if (TangGridVelIn[iMarker] != nullptr) delete [] TangGridVelIn[iMarker];
338  delete [] TangGridVelIn;
339  }
340  if (SpanAreaIn != nullptr) {
341  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nTurboPerf; iMarker++)
342  if (SpanAreaIn[iMarker] != nullptr) delete [] SpanAreaIn[iMarker];
343  delete [] SpanAreaIn;
344  }
345  if (TurboRadiusIn != nullptr) {
346  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nTurboPerf; iMarker++)
347  if (TurboRadiusIn[iMarker] != nullptr) delete [] TurboRadiusIn[iMarker];
348  delete [] TurboRadiusIn;
349  }
350  if (TangGridVelOut != nullptr) {
351  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nTurboPerf; iMarker++)
352  if (TangGridVelOut[iMarker] != nullptr) delete [] TangGridVelOut[iMarker];
353  delete [] TangGridVelOut;
354  }
355  if (SpanAreaOut != nullptr) {
356  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nTurboPerf; iMarker++)
357  if (SpanAreaOut[iMarker] != nullptr) delete [] SpanAreaOut[iMarker];
358  delete [] SpanAreaOut;
359  }
360  if (TurboRadiusOut != nullptr) {
361  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nTurboPerf; iMarker++)
362  if (TurboRadiusOut[iMarker] != nullptr) delete [] TurboRadiusOut[iMarker];
363  delete [] TurboRadiusOut;
364  }
365 
366  /*--- Free up memory from turbomachinery computations
367  * If there are send/receive boundaries, nMarker isn't the same number
368  * as in the constructor. There must be an explicit check to ensure
369  * that iMarker doesn't point us to memory that was never allocated. ---*/
370 
371  unsigned short iSpan, iVertex;
372  if (turbovertex != nullptr) {
373  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
374  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && turbovertex[iMarker] != nullptr) {
375  for (iSpan= 0; iSpan < nSpanSectionsByMarker[iMarker]; iSpan++) {
376  if (turbovertex[iMarker][iSpan] != nullptr) {
377  for (iVertex = 0; iVertex < nVertexSpan[iMarker][iSpan]; iVertex++)
378  if (turbovertex[iMarker][iSpan][iVertex] != nullptr)
379  delete turbovertex[iMarker][iSpan][iVertex];
380  delete [] turbovertex[iMarker][iSpan];
381  }
382  }
383  delete [] turbovertex[iMarker];
384  }
385  }
386  delete [] turbovertex;
387  }
388  if (AverageTurboNormal != nullptr) {
389  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
390  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && AverageTurboNormal[iMarker] != nullptr) {
391  for (iSpan= 0; iSpan < nSpanSectionsByMarker[iMarker]+1; iSpan++)
392  delete [] AverageTurboNormal[iMarker][iSpan];
393  delete [] AverageTurboNormal[iMarker];
394  }
395  }
396  delete [] AverageTurboNormal;
397  }
398  if (AverageNormal != nullptr) {
399  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
400  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && AverageNormal[iMarker] != nullptr) {
401  for (iSpan= 0; iSpan < nSpanSectionsByMarker[iMarker]+1; iSpan++)
402  delete [] AverageNormal[iMarker][iSpan];
403  delete [] AverageNormal[iMarker];
404  }
405  }
406  delete [] AverageNormal;
407  }
408  if (AverageGridVel != nullptr) {
409  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++) {
410  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && AverageGridVel[iMarker] != nullptr) {
411  for (iSpan= 0; iSpan < nSpanSectionsByMarker[iMarker]+1; iSpan++)
412  delete [] AverageGridVel[iMarker][iSpan];
413  delete [] AverageGridVel[iMarker];
414  }
415  }
416  delete [] AverageGridVel;
417  }
418 
419  if (AverageTangGridVel != nullptr) {
420  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
421  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && AverageTangGridVel[iMarker] != nullptr)
422  delete [] AverageTangGridVel[iMarker];
423  delete [] AverageTangGridVel;
424  }
425  if (SpanArea != nullptr) {
426  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
427  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && SpanArea[iMarker] != nullptr)
428  delete [] SpanArea[iMarker];
429  delete [] SpanArea;
430  }
431  if (TurboRadius != nullptr) {
432  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
433  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && TurboRadius[iMarker] != nullptr)
434  delete [] TurboRadius[iMarker];
435  delete [] TurboRadius;
436  }
437  if (MaxAngularCoord != nullptr) {
438  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
439  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && MaxAngularCoord[iMarker] != nullptr)
440  delete [] MaxAngularCoord[iMarker];
441  delete [] MaxAngularCoord;
442  }
443  if (MinAngularCoord != nullptr) {
444  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
445  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && MinAngularCoord[iMarker] != nullptr)
446  delete [] MinAngularCoord[iMarker];
447  delete [] MinAngularCoord;
448  }
449  if (MinRelAngularCoord != nullptr) {
450  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
451  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && MinRelAngularCoord[iMarker] != nullptr)
452  delete [] MinRelAngularCoord[iMarker];
453  delete [] MinRelAngularCoord;
454  }
455 
456  delete [] nSpanWiseSections;
457  delete [] nSpanSectionsByMarker;
458  if (SpanWiseValue != nullptr) {
459  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < 2; iMarker++)
460  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && SpanWiseValue[iMarker] != nullptr)
461  delete [] SpanWiseValue[iMarker];
462  delete [] SpanWiseValue;
463  }
464  if (nVertexSpan != nullptr) {
465  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
466  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && nVertexSpan[iMarker] != nullptr)
467  delete [] nVertexSpan[iMarker];
468  delete [] nVertexSpan;
469  }
470  if (nTotVertexSpan != nullptr) {
471  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker; iMarker++)
472  if (Marker_All_SendRecv[iMarker] == 0 && nTotVertexSpan[iMarker] != nullptr)
473  delete [] nTotVertexSpan[iMarker];
474  delete [] nTotVertexSpan;
475  }
476 
477 }
478 
479 void CPhysicalGeometry::SetGlobal_to_Local_Point(void) {
480  Global_to_Local_Point.clear();
481  for (unsigned long iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPointDomain; iPoint++) {
482  Global_to_Local_Point[nodes->GetGlobalIndex(iPoint)] = iPoint;
483  }
484 }
485 
486 void CPhysicalGeometry::DistributeColoring(const CConfig *config,
487  CGeometry *geometry) {
488 
489  /*--- To start, each linear partition carries the color only for the
490  owned nodes (nPoint), but we have repeated elems on each linear partition.
491  We need to complete the coloring information such that the repeated
492  points on each rank also have their color values. ---*/
493 
494  unsigned short iNode, jNode;
495  unsigned long iPoint, iNeighbor, jPoint, iElem, iProcessor;
496 
497  unordered_set<unsigned long> Point_Map;
498 
499  SU2_MPI::Request *colorSendReq = nullptr, *idSendReq = nullptr;
500  SU2_MPI::Request *colorRecvReq = nullptr, *idRecvReq = nullptr;
501  int iProc, iSend, iRecv, myStart, myFinal;
502 
503  /*--- Get a linear partitioner to track the partition counts. ---*/
504 
505  CLinearPartitioner pointPartitioner(geometry->GetGlobal_nPoint(),0);
506 
507  /*--- First, create a complete map of the points on this rank (excluding
508  repeats) and their neighbors so that we can efficiently loop through the
509  points and decide how to distribute the colors. ---*/
510 
511  for (iElem = 0; iElem < geometry->GetnElem(); iElem++) {
512  for (iNode = 0; iNode < geometry->elem[iElem]->GetnNodes(); iNode++) {
513  iPoint = geometry->elem[iElem]->GetNode(iNode);
514  Point_Map.insert(iPoint);
515  }
516  }
517 
518  /*--- Error check to ensure that the number of points found for this
519  rank matches the number in the mesh file (in serial). ---*/
520 
521  if ((size == SINGLE_NODE) && (Point_Map.size() < geometry->GetnPoint())) {
522  SU2_MPI::Error( string("Mismatch between NPOIN and number of points")
523  +string(" listed in mesh file.\n")
524  +string("Please check the mesh file for correctness.\n"),
525  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
526  }
527 
528  /*--- Create a global to local mapping that includes the unowned points. ---*/
529 
530  unordered_map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Global2Local;
531  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < geometry->GetnPoint(); iPoint++) {
532  Global2Local[geometry->nodes->GetGlobalIndex(iPoint)] = iPoint;
533  }
534 
535  /*--- Find extra points that carry an index higher than nPoint. ---*/
536 
537  jPoint = geometry->GetnPoint();
538  for (auto iPoint : Point_Map) {
539  if ((iPoint < pointPartitioner.GetFirstIndexOnRank(rank)) ||
540  (iPoint >= pointPartitioner.GetLastIndexOnRank(rank))){
541  Global2Local[iPoint] = jPoint;
542  jPoint++;
543  }
544  }
545 
546  /*--- Now create the neighbor list for each owned node (self-inclusive). ---*/
547 
548  Neighbors.clear();
549  Neighbors.resize(Point_Map.size());
550  for (iElem = 0; iElem < geometry->GetnElem(); iElem++) {
551  for (iNode = 0; iNode < geometry->elem[iElem]->GetnNodes(); iNode++) {
552  iPoint = Global2Local[geometry->elem[iElem]->GetNode(iNode)];
553  for (jNode = 0; jNode < geometry->elem[iElem]->GetnNodes(); jNode++) {
554  jPoint = geometry->elem[iElem]->GetNode(jNode);
555  Neighbors[iPoint].push_back(jPoint);
556  }
557  }
558  }
559 
560  /*--- Post-process the neighbor lists. ---*/
561 
562  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < Point_Map.size(); iPoint++) {
563  sort(Neighbors[iPoint].begin(), Neighbors[iPoint].end());
564  auto it = unique(Neighbors[iPoint].begin(), Neighbors[iPoint].end());
565  Neighbors[iPoint].resize(it - Neighbors[iPoint].begin());
566  }
567 
568  /*--- Prepare structures for communication. ---*/
569 
570  int *nPoint_Send = new int[size+1]; nPoint_Send[0] = 0;
571  int *nPoint_Recv = new int[size+1]; nPoint_Recv[0] = 0;
572  int *nPoint_Flag = new int[size];
573 
574  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
575  nPoint_Send[iProc] = 0; nPoint_Recv[iProc] = 0; nPoint_Flag[iProc]= -1;
576  }
577  nPoint_Send[size] = 0; nPoint_Recv[size] = 0;
578 
579  /*--- Loop over the owned points and check all the neighbors for unowned
580  points. The colors of all owned points will be communicated to any ranks
581  that will require them, which is due to the repeated points/elements
582  that were needed to perform the coloring. ---*/
583 
584  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < geometry->GetnPoint(); iPoint++) {
585  for (iNeighbor = 0; iNeighbor < Neighbors[iPoint].size(); iNeighbor++) {
586 
587  /*--- Global ID of the neighbor ---*/
588 
589  jPoint = Neighbors[iPoint][iNeighbor];
590 
591  /*--- Search for the processor that owns this neighbor. ---*/
592 
593  iProcessor = pointPartitioner.GetRankContainingIndex(jPoint);
594 
595  /*--- If we have not visited this node yet, increment our
596  number of points that must be sent to a particular proc. ---*/
597 
598  if (nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iPoint) {
599  nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iPoint;
600  nPoint_Send[iProcessor+1]++;
601  }
602 
603  }
604  }
605 
606  /*--- Communicate the number of nodes to be sent/recv'd amongst
607  all processors. After this communication, each proc knows how
608  many points it will receive from each other processor. ---*/
609 
610  SU2_MPI::Alltoall(&(nPoint_Send[1]), 1, MPI_INT,
611  &(nPoint_Recv[1]), 1, MPI_INT, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
612 
613  /*--- Prepare to send colors. First check how many
614  messages we will be sending and receiving. Here we also put
615  the counters into cumulative storage format to make the
616  communications simpler. ---*/
617 
618  int nSends = 0, nRecvs = 0;
619  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nPoint_Flag[iProc] = -1;
620 
621  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
622  if ((iProc != rank) && (nPoint_Send[iProc+1] > 0)) nSends++;
623  if ((iProc != rank) && (nPoint_Recv[iProc+1] > 0)) nRecvs++;
624 
625  nPoint_Send[iProc+1] += nPoint_Send[iProc];
626  nPoint_Recv[iProc+1] += nPoint_Recv[iProc];
627  }
628 
629  /*--- Allocate arrays for sending the global ID. ---*/
630 
631  unsigned long *idSend = new unsigned long[nPoint_Send[size]];
632  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPoint_Send[size]; iSend++) idSend[iSend] = 0;
633 
634  /*--- Allocate memory to hold the colors that we are sending. ---*/
635 
636  unsigned long *colorSend = new unsigned long[nPoint_Send[size]];
637  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPoint_Send[size]; iSend++) colorSend[iSend] = 0;
638 
639  /*--- Create an index variable to keep track of our index
640  positions as we load up the send buffer. ---*/
641 
642  unsigned long *index = new unsigned long[size];
643  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) index[iProc] = nPoint_Send[iProc];
644 
645  /*--- Now load up our buffers with the Global IDs and colors. ---*/
646 
647  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < geometry->GetnPoint(); iPoint++) {
648  for (iNeighbor = 0; iNeighbor < Neighbors[iPoint].size(); iNeighbor++) {
649 
650  /*--- Global ID of the neighbor ---*/
651 
652  jPoint = Neighbors[iPoint][iNeighbor];
653 
654  /*--- Search for the processor that owns this neighbor ---*/
655 
656  iProcessor = pointPartitioner.GetRankContainingIndex(jPoint);
657 
658  /*--- If we have not visited this node yet, increment our
659  counters and load up the global ID and color. ---*/
660 
661  if (nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iPoint) {
662 
663  nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iPoint;
664  unsigned long nn = index[iProcessor];
665 
666  /*--- Load the data values. ---*/
667 
668  idSend[nn] = geometry->nodes->GetGlobalIndex(iPoint);
669  colorSend[nn] = geometry->nodes->GetColor(iPoint);
670 
671  /*--- Increment the index by the message length ---*/
672 
673  index[iProcessor]++;
674 
675  }
676  }
677  }
678 
679  /*--- Free memory after loading up the send buffer. ---*/
680 
681  delete [] index;
682 
683  /*--- Allocate the memory that we need for receiving the conn
684  values and then cue up the non-blocking receives. Note that
685  we do not include our own rank in the communications. We will
686  directly copy our own data later. ---*/
687 
688  unsigned long *colorRecv = new unsigned long[nPoint_Recv[size]];
689  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++)
690  colorRecv[iRecv] = 0;
691 
692  unsigned long *idRecv = new unsigned long[nPoint_Recv[size]];
693  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++)
694  idRecv[iRecv] = 0;
695 
696  /*--- Allocate memory for the MPI requests if we need to communicate. ---*/
697 
698  if (nSends > 0) {
699  colorSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
700  idSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
701  }
702  if (nRecvs > 0) {
703  colorRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
704  idRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
705  }
706 
707  /*--- Launch the non-blocking sends and receives. ---*/
708 
709  InitiateCommsAll(colorSend, nPoint_Send, colorSendReq,
710  colorRecv, nPoint_Recv, colorRecvReq,
711  1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
712 
713  InitiateCommsAll(idSend, nPoint_Send, idSendReq,
714  idRecv, nPoint_Recv, idRecvReq,
715  1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
716 
717  /*--- Copy my own rank's data into the recv buffer directly. ---*/
718 
719  iRecv = nPoint_Recv[rank];
720  myStart = nPoint_Send[rank];
721  myFinal = nPoint_Send[rank+1];
722  for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
723  colorRecv[iRecv] = colorSend[iSend];
724  idRecv[iRecv] = idSend[iSend];
725  iRecv++;
726  }
727 
728  /*--- Complete the non-blocking communications. ---*/
729 
730  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, colorSendReq, nRecvs, colorRecvReq);
731  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, idSendReq, nRecvs, idRecvReq);
732 
733  /*--- Store the complete color map for this rank in class data. Now,
734  each rank has a color value for all owned nodes as well as any repeated
735  grid points on the rank. Note that there may be repeats that are
736  communicated in the routine above, but since we are storing in a map,
737  it will simply overwrite the same entries. ---*/
738 
739  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
740  Color_List[idRecv[iRecv]] = colorRecv[iRecv];
741  }
742 
743  /*--- Free temporary memory from communications ---*/
744 
745  delete [] colorSendReq;
746  delete [] idSendReq;
747 
748  delete [] colorRecvReq;
749  delete [] idRecvReq;
750 
751  delete [] colorSend;
752  delete [] colorRecv;
753  delete [] idSend;
754  delete [] idRecv;
755  delete [] nPoint_Recv;
756  delete [] nPoint_Send;
757  delete [] nPoint_Flag;
758 
759 }
760 
761 void CPhysicalGeometry::DistributeVolumeConnectivity(const CConfig *config,
762  CGeometry *geometry,
763  unsigned short Elem_Type) {
764 
765  unsigned short NODES_PER_ELEMENT = 0;
766 
767  unsigned long iProcessor;
768  unsigned long iElem, iNode, jNode, nElem_Total = 0, Global_Index;
769  unsigned long *Conn_Elem = nullptr;
770  unsigned long *ID_Elems = nullptr;
771 
772  SU2_MPI::Request *connSendReq = nullptr, *idSendReq = nullptr;
773  SU2_MPI::Request *connRecvReq = nullptr, *idRecvReq = nullptr;
774  int iProc, iSend, iRecv, myStart, myFinal;
775 
776  /*--- Store the number of nodes per this element type. ---*/
777 
778  switch (Elem_Type) {
779  case TRIANGLE:
780  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_TRIANGLE;
781  break;
782  case QUADRILATERAL:
783  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_QUADRILATERAL;
784  break;
785  case TETRAHEDRON:
786  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_TETRAHEDRON;
787  break;
788  case HEXAHEDRON:
789  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_HEXAHEDRON;
790  break;
791  case PRISM:
792  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_PRISM;
793  break;
794  case PYRAMID:
795  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_PYRAMID;
796  break;
797  default:
798  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = 0;
799  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized element type.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
800  break;
801  }
802 
803  /*--- Prepare a mapping for local to global element index. ---*/
804 
805  vector<unsigned long> Local2GlobalElem(geometry->Global_to_Local_Elem.size());
806 
807  for (auto p : geometry->Global_to_Local_Elem) {
808  Local2GlobalElem[p.second] = p.first;
809  }
810 
811  /*--- We start with the connectivity distributed across all procs in a
812  linear partitioning. We need to loop through our local partition
813  and decide how many elements we must send to each other rank in order to
814  have all elements distributed according to the ParMETIS coloring. ---*/
815 
816  int *nElem_Send = new int[size+1]; nElem_Send[0] = 0;
817  int *nElem_Recv = new int[size+1]; nElem_Recv[0] = 0;
818  int *nElem_Flag = new int[size];
819 
820  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
821  nElem_Send[iProc] = 0; nElem_Recv[iProc] = 0; nElem_Flag[iProc]= -1;
822  }
823  nElem_Send[size] = 0; nElem_Recv[size] = 0;
824 
825  for (iElem = 0; iElem < geometry->GetnElem(); iElem++ ) {
826  if (geometry->elem[iElem]->GetVTK_Type() == Elem_Type) {
827  for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++ ) {
828 
829  /*--- Get the index of the current point. ---*/
830 
831  Global_Index = geometry->elem[iElem]->GetNode(iNode);
832 
833  /*--- We have the color stored in a map for all local points. ---*/
834 
835  iProcessor = Color_List[Global_Index];
836 
837  /*--- If we have not visited this element yet, increment our
838  number of elements that must be sent to a particular proc. ---*/
839 
840  if ((nElem_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iElem)) {
841  nElem_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iElem;
842  nElem_Send[iProcessor+1]++;
843  }
844 
845  }
846  }
847  }
848 
849  /*--- Communicate the number of cells to be sent/recv'd amongst
850  all processors. After this communication, each proc knows how
851  many cells it will receive from each other processor. ---*/
852 
853  SU2_MPI::Alltoall(&(nElem_Send[1]), 1, MPI_INT,
854  &(nElem_Recv[1]), 1, MPI_INT, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
855 
856  /*--- Prepare to send connectivities. First check how many
857  messages we will be sending and receiving. Here we also put
858  the counters into cumulative storage format to make the
859  communications simpler. ---*/
860 
861  int nSends = 0, nRecvs = 0;
862  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nElem_Flag[iProc] = -1;
863 
864  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
865  if ((iProc != rank) && (nElem_Send[iProc+1] > 0)) nSends++;
866  if ((iProc != rank) && (nElem_Recv[iProc+1] > 0)) nRecvs++;
867 
868  nElem_Send[iProc+1] += nElem_Send[iProc];
869  nElem_Recv[iProc+1] += nElem_Recv[iProc];
870  }
871 
872  /*--- Allocate memory to hold the connectivity and element IDs
873  that we are sending. ---*/
874 
875  unsigned long *connSend = nullptr;
876  connSend = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[size]];
877  for (iSend = 0; iSend < NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[size]; iSend++)
878  connSend[iSend] = 0;
879 
880  /*--- Allocate arrays for storing element global index. ---*/
881 
882  unsigned long *idSend = new unsigned long[nElem_Send[size]];
883  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nElem_Send[size]; iSend++) idSend[iSend] = 0;
884 
885  /*--- Create an index variable to keep track of our index
886  position as we load up the send buffer. ---*/
887 
888  unsigned long *index = new unsigned long[size];
889  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++)
890  index[iProc] = NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[iProc];
891 
892  unsigned long *idIndex = new unsigned long[size];
893  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++)
894  idIndex[iProc] = nElem_Send[iProc];
895 
896  /*--- Loop through our elements and load the elems and their
897  additional data that we will send to the other procs. ---*/
898 
899  for (iElem = 0; iElem < geometry->GetnElem(); iElem++) {
900  if (geometry->elem[iElem]->GetVTK_Type() == Elem_Type) {
901  for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++ ) {
902 
903  /*--- Get the index of the current point. ---*/
904 
905  Global_Index = geometry->elem[iElem]->GetNode(iNode);
906 
907  /*--- We have the color stored in a map for all local points. ---*/
908 
909  iProcessor = Color_List[Global_Index];
910 
911  /*--- Load connectivity and IDs into the buffer for sending ---*/
912 
913  if (nElem_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iElem) {
914 
915  nElem_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iElem;
916  unsigned long nn = index[iProcessor];
917  unsigned long mm = idIndex[iProcessor];
918 
919  /*--- Load the connectivity values. Note that elements are already
920  stored directly based on their global index for the nodes.---*/
921 
922  for (jNode = 0; jNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; jNode++) {
923  connSend[nn] = geometry->elem[iElem]->GetNode(jNode); nn++;
924  }
925 
926  /*--- Global ID for this element. ---*/
927 
928  idSend[mm] = Local2GlobalElem[iElem];
929 
930  /*--- Increment the index by the message length ---*/
931 
932  index[iProcessor] += NODES_PER_ELEMENT;
933  idIndex[iProcessor]++;
934 
935  }
936  }
937  }
938  }
939 
940  /*--- Free memory after loading up the send buffer. ---*/
941 
942  delete [] index;
943  delete [] idIndex;
944 
945  /*--- Allocate the memory that we need for receiving the
946  values and then cue up the non-blocking receives. Note that
947  we do not include our own rank in the communications. We will
948  directly copy our own data later. ---*/
949 
950  unsigned long *connRecv = nullptr;
951  connRecv = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Recv[size]];
952  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++)
953  connRecv[iRecv] = 0;
954 
955  unsigned long *idRecv = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
956  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) idRecv[iRecv] = 0;
957 
958  /*--- Allocate memory for the MPI requests if we need to communicate. ---*/
959 
960  if (nSends > 0) {
961  connSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
962  idSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
963  }
964  if (nRecvs > 0) {
965  connRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
966  idRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
967  }
968 
969  /*--- Launch the non-blocking sends and receives. ---*/
970 
971  InitiateCommsAll(connSend, nElem_Send, connSendReq,
972  connRecv, nElem_Recv, connRecvReq,
973  NODES_PER_ELEMENT, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
974 
975  InitiateCommsAll(idSend, nElem_Send, idSendReq,
976  idRecv, nElem_Recv, idRecvReq,
977  1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
978 
979  /*--- Copy my own rank's data into the recv buffer directly. ---*/
980 
981  iRecv = NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Recv[rank];
982  myStart = NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[rank];
983  myFinal = NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[rank+1];
984  for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
985  connRecv[iRecv] = connSend[iSend];
986  iRecv++;
987  }
988 
989  iRecv = nElem_Recv[rank];
990  myStart = nElem_Send[rank];
991  myFinal = nElem_Send[rank+1];
992  for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
993  idRecv[iRecv] = idSend[iSend];
994  iRecv++;
995  }
996 
997  /*--- Complete the non-blocking communications. ---*/
998 
999  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, connSendReq, nRecvs, connRecvReq);
1000  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, idSendReq, nRecvs, idRecvReq);
1001 
1002  /*--- Store the connectivity for this rank in the proper structure
1003  It will be loaded into the geometry objects in a later step. ---*/
1004 
1005  if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
1006  Conn_Elem = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Recv[size]];
1007  int count = 0; nElem_Total = 0;
1008  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1009  nElem_Total++;
1010  for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
1011  Conn_Elem[count] = connRecv[iRecv*NODES_PER_ELEMENT+iNode];
1012  count++;
1013  }
1014  }
1015  }
1016 
1017  /*--- Store the global element IDs too. ---*/
1018 
1019  if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
1020  ID_Elems = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1021  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1022  ID_Elems[iRecv] = idRecv[iRecv];
1023  }
1024  }
1025 
1026  /*--- Store the particular element count, IDs, & conn. in the class data,
1027  and set the class data pointer to the connectivity array. ---*/
1028 
1029  switch (Elem_Type) {
1030  case TRIANGLE:
1031  nLocal_Tria = nElem_Total;
1032  if (nLocal_Tria > 0) {
1033  Conn_Tria = Conn_Elem;
1034  ID_Tria = ID_Elems;
1035  }
1036  break;
1037  case QUADRILATERAL:
1038  nLocal_Quad = nElem_Total;
1039  if (nLocal_Quad > 0) {
1040  Conn_Quad = Conn_Elem;
1041  ID_Quad = ID_Elems;
1042  }
1043  break;
1044  case TETRAHEDRON:
1045  nLocal_Tetr = nElem_Total;
1046  if (nLocal_Tetr > 0) {
1047  Conn_Tetr = Conn_Elem;
1048  ID_Tetr = ID_Elems;
1049  }
1050  break;
1051  case HEXAHEDRON:
1052  nLocal_Hexa = nElem_Total;
1053  if (nLocal_Hexa > 0) {
1054  Conn_Hexa = Conn_Elem;
1055  ID_Hexa = ID_Elems;
1056  }
1057  break;
1058  case PRISM:
1059  nLocal_Pris = nElem_Total;
1060  if (nLocal_Pris > 0) {
1061  Conn_Pris = Conn_Elem;
1062  ID_Pris = ID_Elems;
1063  }
1064  break;
1065  case PYRAMID:
1066  nLocal_Pyra = nElem_Total;
1067  if (nLocal_Pyra > 0) {
1068  Conn_Pyra = Conn_Elem;
1069  ID_Pyra = ID_Elems;
1070  }
1071  break;
1072  default:
1073  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized element type.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1074  break;
1075  }
1076 
1077  /*--- Free temporary memory from communications ---*/
1078 
1079  delete [] connSendReq;
1080  delete [] idSendReq;
1081 
1082  delete [] connRecvReq;
1083  delete [] idRecvReq;
1084 
1085  delete [] connSend;
1086  delete [] connRecv;
1087  delete [] idSend;
1088  delete [] idRecv;
1089  delete [] nElem_Recv;
1090  delete [] nElem_Send;
1091  delete [] nElem_Flag;
1092 
1093 }
1094 
1095 void CPhysicalGeometry::DistributePoints(const CConfig *config, CGeometry *geometry) {
1096 
1097  /*--- We now know all of the coloring for our local points and neighbors.
1098  From this, we can communicate the owned nodes in our linear partitioning
1099  to all other ranks, including coordinates and coloring info, so that the
1100  receivers will be able to sort the data. ---*/
1101 
1102  unsigned short iDim;
1103  unsigned long iPoint, iNeighbor, jPoint, iProcessor;
1104 
1105  SU2_MPI::Request *colorSendReq = nullptr, *idSendReq = nullptr, *coordSendReq = nullptr;
1106  SU2_MPI::Request *colorRecvReq = nullptr, *idRecvReq = nullptr, *coordRecvReq = nullptr;
1107  int iProc, iSend, iRecv, myStart, myFinal;
1108 
1109  /*--- Prepare structures for communication. ---*/
1110 
1111  int *nPoint_Send = new int[size+1]; nPoint_Send[0] = 0;
1112  int *nPoint_Recv = new int[size+1]; nPoint_Recv[0] = 0;
1113  int *nPoint_Flag = new int[size];
1114 
1115  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
1116  nPoint_Send[iProc] = 0; nPoint_Recv[iProc] = 0; nPoint_Flag[iProc]= -1;
1117  }
1118  nPoint_Send[size] = 0; nPoint_Recv[size] = 0;
1119 
1120  /*--- Loop over the owned points and check all the neighbors for unowned
1121  points. The colors of all owned points will be communicated to any ranks
1122  that will require them, which is due to the repeated points/elements
1123  that were needed to perform the coloring. ---*/
1124 
1125  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < geometry->GetnPoint(); iPoint++) {
1126  for (iNeighbor = 0; iNeighbor < Neighbors[iPoint].size(); iNeighbor++) {
1127 
1128  /*--- Global ID of the neighbor ---*/
1129 
1130  jPoint = Neighbors[iPoint][iNeighbor];
1131 
1132  /*--- We have the color stored in a map for all local points. ---*/
1133 
1134  iProcessor = Color_List[jPoint];
1135 
1136  /*--- If we have not visited this node yet, increment our
1137  number of points that must be sent to a particular proc. ---*/
1138 
1139  if (nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iPoint) {
1140  nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iPoint;
1141  nPoint_Send[iProcessor+1]++;
1142  }
1143  }
1144  }
1145 
1146  /*--- Communicate the number of nodes to be sent/recv'd amongst
1147  all processors. After this communication, each proc knows how
1148  many points it will receive from each other processor. ---*/
1149 
1150  SU2_MPI::Alltoall(&(nPoint_Send[1]), 1, MPI_INT,
1151  &(nPoint_Recv[1]), 1, MPI_INT, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1152 
1153  /*--- Prepare to send colors, ids, and coords. First check how many
1154  messages we will be sending and receiving. Here we also put
1155  the counters into cumulative storage format to make the
1156  communications simpler. ---*/
1157 
1158  int nSends = 0, nRecvs = 0;
1159  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nPoint_Flag[iProc] = -1;
1160 
1161  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
1162  if ((iProc != rank) && (nPoint_Send[iProc+1] > 0)) nSends++;
1163  if ((iProc != rank) && (nPoint_Recv[iProc+1] > 0)) nRecvs++;
1164 
1165  nPoint_Send[iProc+1] += nPoint_Send[iProc];
1166  nPoint_Recv[iProc+1] += nPoint_Recv[iProc];
1167  }
1168 
1169  /*--- Allocate arrays for sending the global ID. ---*/
1170 
1171  unsigned long *idSend = new unsigned long[nPoint_Send[size]];
1172  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPoint_Send[size]; iSend++) idSend[iSend] = 0;
1173 
1174  /*--- Allocate memory to hold the colors that we are sending. ---*/
1175 
1176  unsigned long *colorSend = new unsigned long[nPoint_Send[size]];
1177  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nPoint_Send[size]; iSend++) colorSend[iSend] = 0;
1178 
1179  /*--- Allocate memory to hold the coordinates that we are sending. ---*/
1180 
1181  su2double *coordSend = nullptr;
1182  coordSend = new su2double[nDim*nPoint_Send[size]];
1183  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nDim*nPoint_Send[size]; iSend++)
1184  coordSend[iSend] = 0;
1185 
1186  /*--- Create index variables to keep track of our index
1187  positions as we load up the send buffer. ---*/
1188 
1189  unsigned long *index = new unsigned long[size];
1190  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++)
1191  index[iProc] = nPoint_Send[iProc];
1192 
1193  unsigned long *coordIndex = new unsigned long[size];
1194  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++)
1195  coordIndex[iProc] = nDim*nPoint_Send[iProc];
1196 
1197  /*--- Now load up our buffers with the colors, ids, and coords. ---*/
1198 
1199  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < geometry->GetnPoint(); iPoint++) {
1200  for (iNeighbor = 0; iNeighbor < Neighbors[iPoint].size(); iNeighbor++) {
1201 
1202  /*--- Global ID of the neighbor ---*/
1203 
1204  jPoint = Neighbors[iPoint][iNeighbor];
1205 
1206  /*--- We have the color stored in a map for all local points. ---*/
1207 
1208  iProcessor = Color_List[jPoint];
1209 
1210  /*--- If we have not visited this node yet, increment our
1211  counters and load up the colors, ids, and coords. ---*/
1212 
1213  if (nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iPoint) {
1214 
1215  nPoint_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iPoint;
1216  unsigned long nn = index[iProcessor];
1217 
1218  /*--- Load the global ID, color, and coordinate values. ---*/
1219 
1220  idSend[nn] = geometry->nodes->GetGlobalIndex(iPoint);
1221  colorSend[nn] = geometry->nodes->GetColor(iPoint);
1222 
1223  nn = coordIndex[iProcessor];
1224  for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) {
1225  coordSend[nn] = geometry->nodes->GetCoord(iPoint, iDim); nn++;
1226  }
1227 
1228  /*--- Increment the index by the message length ---*/
1229 
1230  coordIndex[iProcessor] += nDim;
1231  index[iProcessor]++;
1232 
1233  }
1234  }
1235  }
1236 
1237  /*--- Free memory after loading up the send buffer. ---*/
1238 
1239  delete [] index;
1240  delete [] coordIndex;
1241 
1242  /*--- Allocate the memory that we need for receiving the
1243  values and then cue up the non-blocking receives. Note that
1244  we do not include our own rank in the communications. We will
1245  directly copy our own data later. ---*/
1246 
1247  unsigned long *colorRecv = new unsigned long[nPoint_Recv[size]];
1248  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++)
1249  colorRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1250 
1251  unsigned long *idRecv = new unsigned long[nPoint_Recv[size]];
1252  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++)
1253  idRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1254 
1255  su2double *coordRecv = nullptr;
1256  coordRecv = new su2double[nDim*nPoint_Recv[size]];
1257  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nDim*nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++)
1258  coordRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1259 
1260  /*--- Allocate memory for the MPI requests if we need to communicate. ---*/
1261 
1262  if (nSends > 0) {
1263  colorSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1264  idSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1265  coordSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1266 
1267  }
1268  if (nRecvs > 0) {
1269  colorRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1270  idRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1271  coordRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1272  }
1273 
1274  /*--- Launch the non-blocking sends and receives. ---*/
1275 
1276  InitiateCommsAll(colorSend, nPoint_Send, colorSendReq,
1277  colorRecv, nPoint_Recv, colorRecvReq,
1278  1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1279 
1280  InitiateCommsAll(idSend, nPoint_Send, idSendReq,
1281  idRecv, nPoint_Recv, idRecvReq,
1282  1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1283 
1284  InitiateCommsAll(coordSend, nPoint_Send, coordSendReq,
1285  coordRecv, nPoint_Recv, coordRecvReq,
1286  nDim, COMM_TYPE_DOUBLE);
1287 
1288  /*--- Copy my own rank's data into the recv buffer directly. ---*/
1289 
1290  iRecv = nPoint_Recv[rank];
1291  myStart = nPoint_Send[rank];
1292  myFinal = nPoint_Send[rank+1];
1293  for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1294  colorRecv[iRecv] = colorSend[iSend];
1295  idRecv[iRecv] = idSend[iSend];
1296  iRecv++;
1297  }
1298 
1299  iRecv = nDim*nPoint_Recv[rank];
1300  myStart = nDim*nPoint_Send[rank];
1301  myFinal = nDim*nPoint_Send[rank+1];
1302  for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1303  coordRecv[iRecv] = coordSend[iSend];
1304  iRecv++;
1305  }
1306 
1307  /*--- Complete the non-blocking communications. ---*/
1308 
1309  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, colorSendReq, nRecvs, colorRecvReq);
1310  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, idSendReq, nRecvs, idRecvReq);
1311  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, coordSendReq, nRecvs, coordRecvReq);
1312 
1313  /*--- Store the total number of local points my rank has for
1314  the current section after completing the communications. ---*/
1315 
1316  nLocal_Point = nPoint_Recv[size];
1317 
1318  /*--- Store the proper local IDs, colors, and coordinates. We will load
1319  all of this information into our geometry classes in a later step. ---*/
1320 
1321  Local_Points = new unsigned long[nPoint_Recv[size]];
1322  Local_Colors = new unsigned long[nPoint_Recv[size]];
1323  Local_Coords = new su2double[nDim*nPoint_Recv[size]];
1324 
1325  nLocal_PointDomain = 0; nLocal_PointGhost = 0;
1326  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nPoint_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1327  Local_Points[iRecv] = idRecv[iRecv];
1328  Local_Colors[iRecv] = colorRecv[iRecv];
1329  for (iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++)
1330  Local_Coords[iRecv*nDim+iDim] = coordRecv[iRecv*nDim+iDim];
1331  if (Local_Colors[iRecv] == (unsigned long)rank) nLocal_PointDomain++;
1332  else nLocal_PointGhost++;
1333  }
1334 
1335  /*--- Free temporary memory from communications ---*/
1336 
1337  delete [] colorSendReq;
1338  delete [] idSendReq;
1339  delete [] coordSendReq;
1340 
1341  delete [] colorRecvReq;
1342  delete [] idRecvReq;
1343  delete [] coordRecvReq;
1344 
1345  delete [] colorSend;
1346  delete [] colorRecv;
1347  delete [] idSend;
1348  delete [] idRecv;
1349  delete [] coordSend;
1350  delete [] coordRecv;
1351  delete [] nPoint_Recv;
1352  delete [] nPoint_Send;
1353  delete [] nPoint_Flag;
1354 
1355 }
1356 
1357 void CPhysicalGeometry::PartitionSurfaceConnectivity(CConfig *config,
1358  CGeometry *geometry,
1359  unsigned short Elem_Type) {
1360 
1361  /*--- We begin with all marker information residing on the master rank,
1362  as the master currently stores all marker info when reading the grid.
1363  We first check and communicate basic information that each rank will
1364  need to hold its portion of the linearly partitioned markers. In a
1365  later step, we will distribute the markers according to the ParMETIS
1366  coloring. This intermediate step is necessary since we already have the
1367  correct coloring distributed by the linear partitions, which we would
1368  like to reuse when partitioning the markers. Plus, the markers should
1369  truly be linearly partitioned upon reading the mesh, which we will
1370  change eventually. ---*/
1371 
1372  unsigned short NODES_PER_ELEMENT = 0;
1373 
1374  unsigned long iMarker, iProcessor, iElem, iNode, jNode;
1375  unsigned long nElem_Total = 0, Global_Index, Global_Elem_Index;
1376 
1377  unsigned long *Conn_Elem = nullptr;
1378  unsigned long *Linear_Markers = nullptr;
1379  unsigned long *ID_SurfElem = nullptr;
1380 
1381  SU2_MPI::Request *connSendReq = nullptr, *markerSendReq = nullptr, *idSendReq = nullptr;
1382  SU2_MPI::Request *connRecvReq = nullptr, *markerRecvReq = nullptr, *idRecvReq = nullptr;
1383  int iProc, iSend, iRecv, myStart, myFinal;
1384 
1385  /*--- Store the local number of this element type and the number of nodes
1386  per this element type. In serial, this will be the total number of this
1387  element type in the entire mesh. In parallel, it is the number on only
1388  the current partition. ---*/
1389 
1390  switch (Elem_Type) {
1391  case LINE:
1392  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_LINE;
1393  break;
1394  case TRIANGLE:
1395  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_TRIANGLE;
1396  break;
1397  case QUADRILATERAL:
1398  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_QUADRILATERAL;
1399  break;
1400  default:
1401  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized element type.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1402  break;
1403  }
1404 
1405  int *nElem_Send = new int[size+1]; nElem_Send[0] = 0;
1406  int *nElem_Recv = new int[size+1]; nElem_Recv[0] = 0;
1407  int *nElem_Flag = new int[size];
1408 
1409  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
1410  nElem_Send[iProc] = 0; nElem_Recv[iProc] = 0; nElem_Flag[iProc]= -1;
1411  }
1412  nElem_Send[size] = 0; nElem_Recv[size] = 0;
1413 
1414  /*--- We know that the master owns all of the info and will be the only
1415  rank sending anything, although all ranks might receive something. ---*/
1416 
1417  if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
1418  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < geometry->GetnMarker(); iMarker++) {
1419 
1420  /*--- Reset the flag in between markers, just to ensure that we
1421  don't miss some elements on different markers with the same local
1422  index. ---*/
1423 
1424  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nElem_Flag[iProc]= -1;
1425 
1426  for (iElem = 0; iElem < geometry->GetnElem_Bound(iMarker); iElem++) {
1427 
1428  if (geometry->bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetVTK_Type() == Elem_Type) {
1429 
1430  for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++ ) {
1431 
1432  /*--- Get the index of the current point (stored as global). ---*/
1433 
1434  Global_Index = geometry->bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetNode(iNode);
1435 
1436  /*--- Search for the processor that owns this point ---*/
1437 
1438  iProcessor = GetLinearPartition(Global_Index);
1439 
1440  /*--- If we have not visited this element yet, increment our
1441  number of elements that must be sent to a particular proc. ---*/
1442 
1443  if ((nElem_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iElem)) {
1444  nElem_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iElem;
1445  nElem_Send[iProcessor+1]++;
1446  }
1447  }
1448  }
1449  }
1450  }
1451  }
1452 
1453  /*--- Communicate the number of cells to be sent/recv'd amongst
1454  all processors. After this communication, each proc knows how
1455  many cells it will receive from each other processor. ---*/
1456 
1457  SU2_MPI::Scatter(&(nElem_Send[1]), 1, MPI_INT,
1458  &(nElem_Recv[1]), 1, MPI_INT, MASTER_NODE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1459 
1460  /*--- Prepare to send connectivities. First check how many
1461  messages we will be sending and receiving. Here we also put
1462  the counters into cumulative storage format to make the
1463  communications simpler. ---*/
1464 
1465  int nSends = 0, nRecvs = 0;
1466  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nElem_Flag[iProc] = -1;
1467 
1468  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
1469  if ((iProc != rank) && (nElem_Send[iProc+1] > 0)) nSends++;
1470  if ((iProc != rank) && (nElem_Recv[iProc+1] > 0)) nRecvs++;
1471 
1472  nElem_Send[iProc+1] += nElem_Send[iProc];
1473  nElem_Recv[iProc+1] += nElem_Recv[iProc];
1474  }
1475 
1476  /*--- Allocate memory to hold the connectivity that we are sending. ---*/
1477 
1478  unsigned long *connSend = nullptr;
1479  unsigned long *markerSend = nullptr;
1480  unsigned long *idSend = nullptr;
1481 
1482  if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
1483 
1484  connSend = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[size]];
1485  for (iSend = 0; iSend < NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[size]; iSend++)
1486  connSend[iSend] = 0;
1487 
1488  markerSend = new unsigned long[nElem_Send[size]];
1489  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nElem_Send[size]; iSend++)
1490  markerSend[iSend] = 0;
1491 
1492  idSend = new unsigned long[nElem_Send[size]];
1493  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nElem_Send[size]; iSend++)
1494  idSend[iSend] = 0;
1495 
1496  /*--- Create an index variable to keep track of our index
1497  position as we load up the send buffer. ---*/
1498 
1499  unsigned long *index = new unsigned long[size];
1500  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++)
1501  index[iProc] = NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[iProc];
1502 
1503  unsigned long *markerIndex = new unsigned long[size];
1504  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++)
1505  markerIndex[iProc] = nElem_Send[iProc];
1506 
1507  /*--- Loop through our elements and load the elems and their
1508  additional data that we will send to the other procs. ---*/
1509 
1510  Global_Elem_Index = 0;
1511  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < geometry->GetnMarker(); iMarker++) {
1512 
1513  /*--- Reset the flag in between markers, just to ensure that we
1514  don't miss some elements on different markers with the same local
1515  index. ---*/
1516 
1517  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nElem_Flag[iProc]= -1;
1518 
1519  for (iElem = 0; iElem < geometry->GetnElem_Bound(iMarker); iElem++) {
1520  if (geometry->bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetVTK_Type() == Elem_Type) {
1521  for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++ ) {
1522 
1523  /*--- Get the index of the current point. ---*/
1524 
1525  Global_Index = geometry->bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetNode(iNode);
1526 
1527  /*--- Search for the processor that owns this point ---*/
1528 
1529  iProcessor = GetLinearPartition(Global_Index);
1530 
1531  /*--- Load connectivity into the buffer for sending ---*/
1532 
1533  if ((nElem_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iElem)) {
1534 
1535  nElem_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iElem;
1536  unsigned long nn = index[iProcessor];
1537  unsigned long mm = markerIndex[iProcessor];
1538 
1539  /*--- Load the connectivity values. ---*/
1540 
1541  for (jNode = 0; jNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; jNode++) {
1542  connSend[nn] = geometry->bound[iMarker][iElem]->GetNode(jNode);
1543  nn++;
1544  }
1545 
1546  /*--- Store the marker index and surface elem global ID ---*/
1547 
1548  markerSend[mm] = iMarker;
1549  idSend[mm] = Global_Elem_Index;
1550 
1551  /*--- Increment the index by the message length ---*/
1552 
1553  index[iProcessor] += NODES_PER_ELEMENT;
1554  markerIndex[iProcessor]++;
1555  }
1556 
1557  }
1558  }
1559 
1560  Global_Elem_Index++;
1561 
1562  }
1563  }
1564 
1565  /*--- Free memory after loading up the send buffer. ---*/
1566 
1567  delete [] index;
1568  delete [] markerIndex;
1569 
1570  }
1571 
1572  /*--- Allocate the memory that we need for receiving the conn
1573  values and then cue up the non-blocking receives. Note that
1574  we do not include our own rank in the communications. We will
1575  directly copy our own data later. ---*/
1576 
1577  unsigned long *connRecv = nullptr;
1578  connRecv = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Recv[size]];
1579  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++)
1580  connRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1581 
1582  unsigned long *markerRecv = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1583  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++)
1584  markerRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1585 
1586  unsigned long *idRecv = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1587  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++)
1588  idRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1589 
1590  /*--- Allocate memory for the MPI requests if we need to communicate. ---*/
1591 
1592  if (nSends > 0) {
1593  connSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1594  markerSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1595  idSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1596  }
1597  if (nRecvs > 0) {
1598  connRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1599  markerRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1600  idRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1601  }
1602 
1603  /*--- Launch the non-blocking sends and receives. ---*/
1604 
1605  InitiateCommsAll(connSend, nElem_Send, connSendReq,
1606  connRecv, nElem_Recv, connRecvReq,
1607  NODES_PER_ELEMENT, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1608 
1609  InitiateCommsAll(markerSend, nElem_Send, markerSendReq,
1610  markerRecv, nElem_Recv, markerRecvReq,
1611  1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1612 
1613  InitiateCommsAll(idSend, nElem_Send, idSendReq,
1614  idRecv, nElem_Recv, idRecvReq,
1615  1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1616 
1617  /*--- Copy my own rank's data into the recv buffer directly. ---*/
1618 
1619  if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
1620 
1621  iRecv = NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Recv[rank];
1622  myStart = NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[rank];
1623  myFinal = NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[rank+1];
1624  for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1625  connRecv[iRecv] = connSend[iSend];
1626  iRecv++;
1627  }
1628 
1629  iRecv = nElem_Recv[rank];
1630  myStart = nElem_Send[rank];
1631  myFinal = nElem_Send[rank+1];
1632  for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1633  markerRecv[iRecv] = markerSend[iSend];
1634  idRecv[iRecv] = idSend[iSend];
1635  iRecv++;
1636  }
1637 
1638  }
1639 
1640  /*--- Complete the non-blocking communications. ---*/
1641 
1642  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, connSendReq, nRecvs, connRecvReq);
1643  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, markerSendReq, nRecvs, markerRecvReq);
1644  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, idSendReq, nRecvs, idRecvReq);
1645 
1646  /*--- Store the connectivity for this rank in the proper data
1647  structure before post-processing below. First, allocate
1648  appropriate amount of memory for this section. ---*/
1649 
1650  if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
1651  Conn_Elem = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Recv[size]];
1652  int count = 0; nElem_Total = 0;
1653  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1654  nElem_Total++;
1655  for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
1656  Conn_Elem[count] = connRecv[iRecv*NODES_PER_ELEMENT+iNode];
1657  count++;
1658  }
1659  }
1660  }
1661 
1662  /*--- Store the global marker ID for each element. ---*/
1663 
1664  if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
1665  Linear_Markers = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1666  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1667  Linear_Markers[iRecv] = markerRecv[iRecv];
1668  }
1669  }
1670 
1671  /*--- Store the global surface elem ID for each element. ---*/
1672 
1673  if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
1674  ID_SurfElem = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1675  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
1676  ID_SurfElem[iRecv] = idRecv[iRecv];
1677  }
1678  }
1679 
1680  /*--- Store the particular global element count in the class data,
1681  and set the class data pointer to the connectivity array. ---*/
1682 
1683  switch (Elem_Type) {
1684  case LINE:
1685  nLinear_Line = nElem_Total;
1686  if (nLinear_Line > 0) {
1687  Conn_Line_Linear = Conn_Elem;
1688  ID_Line_Linear = Linear_Markers;
1689  Elem_ID_Line_Linear = ID_SurfElem;
1690  }
1691  break;
1692  case TRIANGLE:
1693  nLinear_BoundTria = nElem_Total;
1694  if (nLinear_BoundTria > 0) {
1695  Conn_BoundTria_Linear = Conn_Elem;
1696  ID_BoundTria_Linear = Linear_Markers;
1697  Elem_ID_BoundTria_Linear = ID_SurfElem;
1698  }
1699  break;
1700  case QUADRILATERAL:
1701  nLinear_BoundQuad = nElem_Total;
1702  if (nLinear_BoundQuad > 0) {
1703  Conn_BoundQuad_Linear = Conn_Elem;
1704  ID_BoundQuad_Linear = Linear_Markers;
1705  Elem_ID_BoundQuad_Linear = ID_SurfElem;
1706  }
1707  break;
1708  default:
1709  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized element type.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1710  break;
1711  }
1712 
1713  /*--- Free temporary memory from communications ---*/
1714 
1715  delete [] connSendReq;
1716  delete [] markerSendReq;
1717  delete [] idSendReq;
1718 
1719  delete [] connRecvReq;
1720  delete [] markerRecvReq;
1721  delete [] idRecvReq;
1722 
1723  delete [] connSend;
1724  delete [] markerSend;
1725  delete [] idSend;
1726 
1727  delete [] connRecv;
1728  delete [] markerRecv;
1729  delete [] idRecv;
1730 
1731  delete [] nElem_Recv;
1732  delete [] nElem_Send;
1733  delete [] nElem_Flag;
1734 
1735 }
1736 
1737 void CPhysicalGeometry::DistributeSurfaceConnectivity(CConfig *config,
1738  CGeometry *geometry,
1739  unsigned short Elem_Type) {
1740 
1741  unsigned short NODES_PER_ELEMENT = 0;
1742 
1743  unsigned long iProcessor, NELEM = 0;
1744  unsigned long iElem, iNode, jNode, nElem_Total = 0, Global_Index;
1745 
1746  unsigned long *Conn_Linear = nullptr;
1747  unsigned long *Conn_Elem = nullptr;
1748  unsigned long *Linear_Markers = nullptr;
1749  unsigned long *ID_SurfElem_Linear = nullptr;
1750  unsigned long *Local_Markers = nullptr;
1751  unsigned long *ID_SurfElem = nullptr;
1752 
1753  SU2_MPI::Request *connSendReq = nullptr,*markerSendReq = nullptr,*idSendReq = nullptr;
1754  SU2_MPI::Request *connRecvReq = nullptr,*markerRecvReq = nullptr,*idRecvReq = nullptr;
1755  int iProc, iSend, iRecv, myStart, myFinal;
1756 
1757  /*--- Store the local number of this element type and the number of nodes
1758  per this element type. In serial, this will be the total number of this
1759  element type in the entire mesh. In parallel, it is the number on only
1760  the current partition. ---*/
1761 
1762  switch (Elem_Type) {
1763  case LINE:
1764  NELEM = nLinear_Line;
1765  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_LINE;
1766  Conn_Linear = Conn_Line_Linear;
1767  Linear_Markers = ID_Line_Linear;
1768  ID_SurfElem_Linear = Elem_ID_Line_Linear;
1769  break;
1770  case TRIANGLE:
1771  NELEM = nLinear_BoundTria;
1772  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_TRIANGLE;
1773  Conn_Linear = Conn_BoundTria_Linear;
1774  Linear_Markers = ID_BoundTria_Linear;
1775  ID_SurfElem_Linear = Elem_ID_BoundTria_Linear;
1776  break;
1777  case QUADRILATERAL:
1778  NELEM = nLinear_BoundQuad;
1779  NODES_PER_ELEMENT = N_POINTS_QUADRILATERAL;
1780  Conn_Linear = Conn_BoundQuad_Linear;
1781  Linear_Markers = ID_BoundQuad_Linear;
1782  ID_SurfElem_Linear = Elem_ID_BoundQuad_Linear;
1783  break;
1784  default:
1785  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized element type.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1786  break;
1787  }
1788 
1789  /*--- We start with the connectivity distributed across all procs in a
1790  linear partitioning. We need to loop through our local partition
1791  and decide how many elements we must send to each other rank in order to
1792  have all elements distributed according to the ParMETIS coloring. ---*/
1793 
1794  int *nElem_Send = new int[size+1]; nElem_Send[0] = 0;
1795  int *nElem_Recv = new int[size+1]; nElem_Recv[0] = 0;
1796  int *nElem_Flag = new int[size];
1797 
1798  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
1799  nElem_Send[iProc] = 0; nElem_Recv[iProc] = 0; nElem_Flag[iProc]= -1;
1800  }
1801  nElem_Send[size] = 0; nElem_Recv[size] = 0;
1802 
1803  for (iElem = 0; iElem < NELEM; iElem++) {
1804  for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
1805 
1806  /*--- Get the index of the current point. ---*/
1807 
1808  Global_Index = Conn_Linear[iElem*NODES_PER_ELEMENT+iNode];
1809 
1810  /*--- We have the color stored in a map for all local points. ---*/
1811 
1812  iProcessor = Color_List[Global_Index];
1813 
1814  /*--- If we have not visited this element yet, increment our
1815  number of elements that must be sent to a particular proc. ---*/
1816 
1817  if ((nElem_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iElem)) {
1818  nElem_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iElem;
1819  nElem_Send[iProcessor+1]++;
1820  }
1821 
1822  }
1823  }
1824 
1825  /*--- Communicate the number of cells to be sent/recv'd amongst
1826  all processors. After this communication, each proc knows how
1827  many cells it will receive from each other processor. ---*/
1828 
1829  SU2_MPI::Alltoall(&(nElem_Send[1]), 1, MPI_INT,
1830  &(nElem_Recv[1]), 1, MPI_INT, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1831 
1832  /*--- Prepare to send connectivities. First check how many
1833  messages we will be sending and receiving. Here we also put
1834  the counters into cumulative storage format to make the
1835  communications simpler. ---*/
1836 
1837  int nSends = 0, nRecvs = 0;
1838  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) nElem_Flag[iProc] = -1;
1839 
1840  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++) {
1841  if ((iProc != rank) && (nElem_Send[iProc+1] > 0)) nSends++;
1842  if ((iProc != rank) && (nElem_Recv[iProc+1] > 0)) nRecvs++;
1843 
1844  nElem_Send[iProc+1] += nElem_Send[iProc];
1845  nElem_Recv[iProc+1] += nElem_Recv[iProc];
1846  }
1847 
1848  /*--- Allocate memory to hold the connectivity that we are
1849  sending. ---*/
1850 
1851  unsigned long *connSend = nullptr;
1852  connSend = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[size]];
1853  for (iSend = 0; iSend < NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[size]; iSend++)
1854  connSend[iSend] = 0;
1855 
1856  /*--- Allocate arrays for storing the marker global index. ---*/
1857 
1858  unsigned long *markerSend = new unsigned long[nElem_Send[size]];
1859  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nElem_Send[size]; iSend++) markerSend[iSend] = 0;
1860 
1861  unsigned long *idSend = new unsigned long[nElem_Send[size]];
1862  for (iSend = 0; iSend < nElem_Send[size]; iSend++) idSend[iSend] = 0;
1863 
1864  /*--- Create an index variable to keep track of our index
1865  position as we load up the send buffer. ---*/
1866 
1867  unsigned long *index = new unsigned long[size];
1868  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++)
1869  index[iProc] = NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[iProc];
1870 
1871  unsigned long *markerIndex = new unsigned long[size];
1872  for (iProc = 0; iProc < size; iProc++)
1873  markerIndex[iProc] = nElem_Send[iProc];
1874 
1875  /*--- Loop through our elements and load the elems and their
1876  additional data that we will send to the other procs. ---*/
1877 
1878  for (iElem = 0; iElem < NELEM; iElem++) {
1879  for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
1880 
1881  /*--- Get the index of the current point. ---*/
1882 
1883  Global_Index = Conn_Linear[iElem*NODES_PER_ELEMENT+iNode];
1884 
1885  /*--- We have the color stored in a map for all local points. ---*/
1886 
1887  iProcessor = Color_List[Global_Index];
1888 
1889  /*--- If we have not visited this element yet, load up the data
1890  for sending. ---*/
1891 
1892  if (nElem_Flag[iProcessor] != (int)iElem) {
1893 
1894  nElem_Flag[iProcessor] = (int)iElem;
1895  unsigned long nn = index[iProcessor];
1896  unsigned long mm = markerIndex[iProcessor];
1897 
1898  /*--- Load the connectivity values. ---*/
1899 
1900  for (jNode = 0; jNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; jNode++) {
1901 
1902  /*--- Note that elements are already stored directly based on
1903  their global index for the nodes. ---*/
1904 
1905  connSend[nn] = Conn_Linear[iElem*NODES_PER_ELEMENT+jNode]; nn++;
1906 
1907  }
1908 
1909  /*--- Global marker ID for this element. ---*/
1910 
1911  markerSend[mm] = Linear_Markers[iElem];
1912  idSend[mm] = ID_SurfElem_Linear[iElem];
1913 
1914  /*--- Increment the index by the message length ---*/
1915 
1916  index[iProcessor] += NODES_PER_ELEMENT;
1917  markerIndex[iProcessor]++;
1918 
1919  }
1920  }
1921  }
1922 
1923  /*--- Free memory after loading up the send buffer. ---*/
1924 
1925  delete [] index;
1926  delete [] markerIndex;
1927 
1928  /*--- Allocate the memory that we need for receiving the conn
1929  values and then cue up the non-blocking receives. Note that
1930  we do not include our own rank in the communications. We will
1931  directly copy our own data later. ---*/
1932 
1933  unsigned long *connRecv = nullptr;
1934  connRecv = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Recv[size]];
1935  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++)
1936  connRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1937 
1938  unsigned long *markerRecv = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1939  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) markerRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1940 
1941  unsigned long *idRecv = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
1942  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) idRecv[iRecv] = 0;
1943 
1944  /*--- Allocate memory for the MPI requests if we need to communicate. ---*/
1945 
1946  if (nSends > 0) {
1947  connSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1948  markerSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1949  idSendReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nSends];
1950  }
1951  if (nRecvs > 0) {
1952  connRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1953  markerRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1954  idRecvReq = new SU2_MPI::Request[nRecvs];
1955  }
1956 
1957  /*--- Launch the non-blocking sends and receives. ---*/
1958 
1959  InitiateCommsAll(connSend, nElem_Send, connSendReq,
1960  connRecv, nElem_Recv, connRecvReq,
1961  NODES_PER_ELEMENT, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1962 
1963  InitiateCommsAll(markerSend, nElem_Send, markerSendReq,
1964  markerRecv, nElem_Recv, markerRecvReq,
1965  1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1966 
1967  InitiateCommsAll(idSend, nElem_Send, idSendReq,
1968  idRecv, nElem_Recv, idRecvReq,
1969  1, COMM_TYPE_UNSIGNED_LONG);
1970 
1971  /*--- Copy my own rank's data into the recv buffer directly. ---*/
1972 
1973  iRecv = NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Recv[rank];
1974  myStart = NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[rank];
1975  myFinal = NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Send[rank+1];
1976  for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1977  connRecv[iRecv] = connSend[iSend];
1978  iRecv++;
1979  }
1980 
1981  iRecv = nElem_Recv[rank];
1982  myStart = nElem_Send[rank];
1983  myFinal = nElem_Send[rank+1];
1984  for (iSend = myStart; iSend < myFinal; iSend++) {
1985  markerRecv[iRecv] = markerSend[iSend];
1986  idRecv[iRecv] = idSend[iSend];
1987  iRecv++;
1988  }
1989 
1990  /*--- Complete the non-blocking communications. ---*/
1991 
1992  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, connSendReq, nRecvs, connRecvReq);
1993  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, markerSendReq, nRecvs, markerRecvReq);
1994  CompleteCommsAll(nSends, idSendReq, nRecvs, idRecvReq);
1995 
1996  /*--- Store the connectivity for this rank in the proper data
1997  structure. It will be loaded into the geometry objects in a later step. ---*/
1998 
1999  if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
2000  Conn_Elem = new unsigned long[NODES_PER_ELEMENT*nElem_Recv[size]];
2001  int count = 0; nElem_Total = 0;
2002  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
2003  nElem_Total++;
2004  for (iNode = 0; iNode < NODES_PER_ELEMENT; iNode++) {
2005  Conn_Elem[count] = connRecv[iRecv*NODES_PER_ELEMENT+iNode];
2006  count++;
2007  }
2008  }
2009  }
2010 
2011  /*--- Store the global marker IDs too. ---*/
2012 
2013  if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
2014  Local_Markers = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
2015  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
2016  Local_Markers[iRecv] = markerRecv[iRecv];
2017  }
2018  }
2019 
2020  /*--- Store the global surface elem IDs too. ---*/
2021 
2022  if (nElem_Recv[size] > 0) {
2023  ID_SurfElem = new unsigned long[nElem_Recv[size]];
2024  for (iRecv = 0; iRecv < nElem_Recv[size]; iRecv++) {
2025  ID_SurfElem[iRecv] = idRecv[iRecv];
2026  }
2027  }
2028 
2029  /*--- Store the particular global element count in the class data,
2030  and set the class data pointer to the connectivity array. ---*/
2031 
2032  switch (Elem_Type) {
2033  case LINE:
2034  nLocal_Line = nElem_Total;
2035  if (nLocal_Line > 0) {
2036  Conn_Line = Conn_Elem;
2037  ID_Line = Local_Markers;
2038  Elem_ID_Line = ID_SurfElem;
2039  }
2040  break;
2041  case TRIANGLE:
2042  nLocal_BoundTria = nElem_Total;
2043  if (nLocal_BoundTria > 0) {
2044  Conn_BoundTria = Conn_Elem;
2045  ID_BoundTria = Local_Markers;
2046  Elem_ID_BoundTria = ID_SurfElem;
2047  }
2048  break;
2049  case QUADRILATERAL:
2050  nLocal_BoundQuad = nElem_Total;
2051  if (nLocal_BoundQuad > 0) {
2052  Conn_BoundQuad = Conn_Elem;
2053  ID_BoundQuad = Local_Markers;
2054  Elem_ID_BoundQuad = ID_SurfElem;
2055  }
2056  break;
2057  default:
2058  SU2_MPI::Error("Unrecognized element type.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
2059  break;
2060  }
2061 
2062  /*--- Free temporary memory from communications ---*/
2063 
2064  delete [] connSendReq;
2065  delete [] markerSendReq;
2066  delete [] idSendReq;
2067 
2068  delete [] connRecvReq;
2069  delete [] markerRecvReq;
2070  delete [] idRecvReq;
2071 
2072  delete [] connSend;
2073  delete [] connRecv;
2074  delete [] markerSend;
2075  delete [] markerRecv;
2076  delete [] idSend;
2077  delete [] idRecv;
2078  delete [] nElem_Recv;
2079  delete [] nElem_Send;
2080  delete [] nElem_Flag;
2081 
2082 }
2083 
2084 void CPhysicalGeometry::DistributeMarkerTags(CConfig *config, CGeometry *geometry) {
2085 
2086  unsigned long iMarker, index, iChar;
2087 
2088  char str_buf[MAX_STRING_SIZE];
2089 
2090  /*--- The master node will communicate the entire list of marker tags
2091  (in global ordering) so that it will be simple for each rank to grab
2092  the string name for each marker. ---*/
2093 
2094  nMarker_Global = 0;
2095  if (rank == MASTER_NODE) nMarker_Global = config->GetnMarker_All();
2096 
2097  /*--- Broadcast the global number of markers in the mesh. ---*/
2098 
2099  SU2_MPI::Bcast(&nMarker_Global, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG,
2100  MASTER_NODE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2101 
2102  char *mpi_str_buf = new char[nMarker_Global*MAX_STRING_SIZE]();
2103  if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
2104  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker_Global; iMarker++) {
2105  SPRINTF(&mpi_str_buf[iMarker*MAX_STRING_SIZE], "%s",
2106  config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker).c_str());
2107  }
2108  }
2109 
2110  /*--- Broadcast the string names of the variables. ---*/
2111 
2112  SU2_MPI::Bcast(mpi_str_buf, (int)nMarker_Global*MAX_STRING_SIZE, MPI_CHAR,
2113  MASTER_NODE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2114 
2115  /*--- Now parse the string names and load into our marker tag vector.
2116  We also need to set the values of all markers into the config. ---*/
2117 
2118  for (iMarker = 0; iMarker < nMarker_Global; iMarker++) {
2119  index = iMarker*MAX_STRING_SIZE;
2120  for (iChar = 0; iChar < MAX_STRING_SIZE; iChar++) {
2121  str_buf[iChar] = mpi_str_buf[index + iChar];
2122  }
2123  Marker_Tags.push_back(str_buf);
2124  config->SetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker,str_buf);
2125  config->SetMarker_All_SendRecv(iMarker,NO);
2126  }
2127 
2128  /*--- Free string buffer memory. ---*/
2129 
2130  delete [] mpi_str_buf;
2131 
2132 }
2133 
2134 void CPhysicalGeometry::LoadPoints(CConfig *config, CGeometry *geometry) {
2135 
2136  unsigned long iPoint, jPoint, iOwned, iPeriodic, iGhost;
2137 
2138  /*--- Create the basic point structures before storing the points. ---*/
2139 
2140  nPoint = nLocal_Point;
2141  nPointDomain = nLocal_PointDomain;
2142 
2143  nodes = new CPoint(nPoint, nDim, MESH_0, config);
2144 
2145  Local_to_Global_Point = new long[nPoint];
2146 
2147  /*--- Array initialization ---*/
2148 
2149  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPoint; iPoint++) {
2150  Local_to_Global_Point[iPoint] = -1;
2151  }
2152 
2153  /*--- Set our counters correctly based on the number of owned and ghost
2154  nodes that we counted during the partitioning. ---*/
2155 
2156  jPoint = 0;
2157  iOwned = 0;
2158  iPeriodic = nLocal_PointDomain;
2159  iGhost = nLocal_PointDomain + nLocal_PointPeriodic;
2160 
2161  /*--- Loop over all of the points that we have recv'd and store the
2162  coordinates, global index, and colors ---*/
2163 
2164  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPoint; iPoint++) {
2165 
2166  /*--- Set the starting point to the correct counter for this point. ---*/
2167 
2168  if (Local_Colors[iPoint] == (unsigned long)rank) {
2169  if (Local_Points[iPoint] < geometry->GetGlobal_nPointDomain())
2170  jPoint = iOwned;
2171  else jPoint = iPeriodic;
2172  } else {
2173  jPoint = iGhost;
2174  }
2175 
2176  /*--- Get the global index ---*/
2177 
2178  Local_to_Global_Point[jPoint] = Local_Points[iPoint];
2179 
2180  /*--- Allocating the Point object ---*/
2181 
2182  nodes->SetCoord(jPoint, &Local_Coords[iPoint*nDim]);
2183  nodes->SetGlobalIndex(jPoint, Local_to_Global_Point[jPoint]);
2184 
2185  /*--- Set the color ---*/
2186 
2187  nodes->SetColor(jPoint, Local_Colors[iPoint]);
2188 
2189  /*--- Increment the correct counter before moving to the next point. ---*/
2190 
2191  if (Local_Colors[iPoint] == (unsigned long)rank) {
2192  if (Local_Points[iPoint] < geometry->GetGlobal_nPointDomain())
2193  iOwned++;
2194  else iPeriodic++;
2195  } else {
2196  iGhost++;
2197  }
2198  }
2199 
2200  /*--- Create the global to local mapping, which will be useful for loading
2201  the elements and boundaries in subsequent steps. ---*/
2202 
2203  for (iPoint = 0; iPoint < nPoint; iPoint++)
2204  Global_to_Local_Point[Local_to_Global_Point[iPoint]] = iPoint;
2205 
2206  /*--- Set the value of Global_nPoint and Global_nPointDomain ---*/
2207 
2208  unsigned long Local_nPoint = nPoint;
2209  unsigned long Local_nPointDomain = nPointDomain;
2210 
2211 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2212  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&Local_nPoint, &Global_nPoint, 1,
2213  MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2214  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&Local_nPointDomain, &Global_nPointDomain, 1,
2215  MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2216 #else
2217  Global_nPoint = Local_nPoint;
2218  Global_nPointDomain = Local_nPointDomain;
2219 #endif
2220 
2221  if ((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (size > SINGLE_NODE))
2222  cout << Global_nPoint << " vertices including ghost points. " << endl;
2223 
2224 }
2225 
2226 void CPhysicalGeometry::LoadVolumeElements(CConfig *config, CGeometry *geometry) {
2227 
2228  unsigned short NODES_PER_ELEMENT;
2229 
2230  unsigned long iElem, jElem, kElem, iNode, Local_Elem, iGlobal_Index;
2231  unsigned long Local_Nodes[N_POINTS_HEXAHEDRON];
2232 
2233  unsigned long iElemTria = 0;
2234  unsigned long iElemQuad = 0;
2235  unsigned long iElemTetr = 0;
2236  unsigned long iElemHexa = 0;
2237  unsigned long iElemPris = 0;
2238  unsigned long iElemPyra = 0;
2239 
2240  unsigned long nTria, nQuad, nTetr, nHexa, nPris, nPyra;
2241 
2242  map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Tria_List;
2243  map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Quad_List;
2244  map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Tetr_List;
2245  map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Hexa_List;
2246  map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Pris_List;
2247  map<unsigned long, unsigned long> Pyra_List;
2248  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator it;
2249 
2250  /*--- It is possible that we have repeated elements during the previous
2251  communications, as we mostly focus on the grid points and their colors.
2252  First, loop through our local elements and build a mapping by simply
2253  overwriting the duplicate entries. ---*/
2254 
2255  jElem = 0;
2256  for (iElem=0; iElem < nLocal_Tria; iElem++) {
2257  Tria_List[ID_Tria[iElem]] = iElem;
2258  }
2259  nTria = Tria_List.size();
2260 
2261  jElem = 0;
2262  for (iElem=0; iElem < nLocal_Quad; iElem++) {
2263  Quad_List[ID_Quad[iElem]] = iElem;
2264  }
2265  nQuad = Quad_List.size();
2266 
2267  jElem = 0;
2268  for (iElem=0; iElem < nLocal_Tetr; iElem++) {
2269  Tetr_List[ID_Tetr[iElem]] = iElem;
2270  }
2271  nTetr = Tetr_List.size();
2272 
2273  jElem = 0;
2274  for (iElem=0; iElem < nLocal_Hexa; iElem++) {
2275  Hexa_List[ID_Hexa[iElem]] = iElem;
2276  }
2277  nHexa = Hexa_List.size();
2278 
2279  jElem = 0;
2280  for (iElem=0; iElem < nLocal_Pris; iElem++) {
2281  Pris_List[ID_Pris[iElem]] = iElem;
2282  }
2283  nPris = Pris_List.size();
2284 
2285  jElem = 0;
2286  for (iElem=0; iElem < nLocal_Pyra; iElem++) {
2287  Pyra_List[ID_Pyra[iElem]] = iElem;
2288  }
2289  nPyra = Pyra_List.size();
2290 
2291  /*--- Reduce the final count of non-repeated elements on this rank. ---*/
2292 
2293  Local_Elem = nTria + nQuad + nTetr + nHexa + nPris + nPyra;
2294 
2295  /*--- Create the basic structures for holding the grid elements. ---*/
2296 
2297  jElem = 0;
2298  nElem = Local_Elem;
